org.apache.ignite.streamer

Interface StreamerWindow<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StreamerBoundedSizeBatchWindow, StreamerBoundedSizeSortedWindow, StreamerBoundedSizeWindow, StreamerBoundedTimeBatchWindow, StreamerBoundedTimeWindow, StreamerUnboundedWindow, StreamerWindowAdapter

    public interface StreamerWindow<E>
extends Iterable<E>
    Streamer rolling window. Rolling windows allow new event to come in, as well as automatically evicting obsolete events on the other side. Windows allow to query into specific time-frame or specific sample size of the events. With windows, you can answer questions like "What are my top 10 best selling products over last 24 hours?", or "Who are my top 10 users out of last 1,000,000 users who logged in?"

    Ignite comes with following rolling windows implementations out of the box:

    • StreamerUnboundedWindow
    • StreamerBoundedSizeWindow
    • StreamerBoundedSizeBatchWindow
    • StreamerBoundedSizeSortedWindow
    • StreamerBoundedTimeWindow
    • StreamerBoundedTimeBatchWindow

    Streamer window is configured via StreamerConfiguration.getWindows() method.

      • name

        String name()
        Gets window name.
        Returns:
        Window name.

      • index

        <K,V> StreamerIndex<E,K,V> index()
        Gets default index, if default index is not configured then IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Type of the index key.
        V - Type of the index value.
        Returns:
        Index with default name.

      • index

        <K,V> StreamerIndex<E,K,V> index(@Nullable
                               String name)
        Gets index by name, if not index with such name was configured then IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Type of the index key.
        V - Type of the index value.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the index, if null then analogous to index().
        Returns:
        Index with a given name.

      • indexes

        Collection<StreamerIndex<E,?,?>> indexes()
        Gets all indexes configured for this window.
        Returns:
        All indexes configured for this window or empty collection, if no indexes were configured.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets window. Usually will clear all events from window.

        int size()
        Gets number of events currently stored in window.
        Returns:
        Current size of the window.

        Gets number of entries available for eviction.

        Number of entries available for eviction.

                throws IgniteException
        Adds single event to window.
        Parameters:
        evt - Event to add.
        Returns:
        True if event was added.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

        boolean enqueue(E... evts)
                throws IgniteException
        Adds events to window.
        Parameters:
        evts - Events to add.

        Throws:

      • enqueueAll

        boolean enqueueAll(Collection<E> evts)
                   throws IgniteException
        Adds all events to window.
        Parameters:
        evts - Collection of events to add.
        Returns:
        True if all events were added, false if at least 1 event was skipped.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • dequeue

        @Nullable
E dequeue()
          throws IgniteException
        Dequeues last element from windows. Will return null if window is empty.
        Returns:
        Dequeued element.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • dequeue

        Collection<E> dequeue(int cnt)
                      throws IgniteException
        Dequeues up to cnt elements from window. If current window size is less than cnt, will dequeue all elements from window.
        Parameters:
        cnt - Count to dequeue.
        Returns:
        Collection of dequeued elements.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • dequeueAll

        Collection<E> dequeueAll()
                         throws IgniteException
        Dequeues all elements from window.
        Returns:
        Collection of dequeued elements.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • pollEvicted

        @Nullable
E pollEvicted()
              throws IgniteException
        If window supports eviction, this method will return next evicted element.
        Returns:
        Polls and returns next evicted event or null if eviction queue is empty or if window does not support eviction.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • pollEvicted

        Collection<E> pollEvicted(int cnt)
                          throws IgniteException
        If window supports eviction, this method will return up to cnt evicted elements.
        Parameters:
        cnt - Number of elements to evict.
        Returns:
        Collection of evicted elements.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • pollEvictedBatch

        Collection<E> pollEvictedBatch()
                               throws IgniteException
        If window supports batch eviction, this method will poll next evicted batch from window. If windows does not support batch eviction but supports eviction, will return collection of single last evicted element. If window does not support eviction, will return empty collection.
        Returns:
        Next evicted batch.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • pollEvictedAll

        Collection<E> pollEvictedAll()
                             throws IgniteException
        If window supports eviction, this method will return all available evicted elements.
        Returns:
        Collection of evicted elements.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • clearEvicted

        void clearEvicted()
                  throws IgniteException
        Clears all evicted entries.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If index update failed.

      • snapshot

        Collection<E> snapshot(boolean includeIvicted)
        Create window snapshot. Evicted entries are not included.
        Parameters:
        includeIvicted - Whether to include evicted entries or not.
        Returns:
        Window snapshot.
